intro: Dampiera fusca, commonly known as the scarlet pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and are often adorned with a distinctive red or orange spot. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and rocky areas. Dampiera fusca is known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
